easy.notes: Easy groups: (1) Animals with wings: recognizable flying creatures. (2) Fruits you can find on trees. (3) Baked goods commonly found in ovens. (4) Furniture you sit on. Near-miss temptation: 'chair' could be in 'things you sit on' but fits clearly as a class item; avoid reusing similar seating words in other groups.

medium.notes: Medium groups: (1) Prefix group uses common 'un-' words; (2) Compound words formed by joining two real words; (3) Color as a leading word in familiar phrases; (4) Animal homes. Near-miss temptation: 'bluebird' might tempt to group with colors, but it's clearly a noun with combined meaning; 'orangeade' could tempt with color 'orange' but is a drink, so kept in color clue group for its first word usage.

hard.notes: Hard groups: (1) Subtlety with 'clip' duplicated here; ensure unique items per puzzle; (2) Clock parts; (3) Opposites by theme where 'wet/dry' and 'hot/cold' are pairings; (4) Basic shapes. Near-miss temptation: 'clock' terms like 'dial' could fit both 'Parts of a Clock' and 'Shapes in 2D Space' if stretched; clarified here to keep distinct categories. Ensure no item overlaps across all groups within the puzzle.
